result.execSummary:
The defendant David John Seifert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant may be discharged early if the agent requests. 
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.
Court cost/obligations are to be paid over the course of probation.

records.addlTxt: DIscharge Regular

11:14 AM Defendant David John Seifert in court.  Def showed receipt of payment. Court: def still owes about $13.00. Defendant to pay by 2/18 then Defendant does not need to be extended unless the Agent can show good cause.  11:17
Probation review hearing on January 28, 2019 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction. Extended 1 year: successful completion of Wabasha Substance Abuse Court and pay all court costs in full.

11:55 Defendant David John Seifert in court. Agent Gilby in court, requests extension of probation to complete drug treatment finished in Wabasha. Agent Gilby to complete extension, payment of $518 will be due before being discharged. 11:57

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on January 9, 2018 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 10:42 Defendant David John Seifert in court, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent P Lynner is present in Court; asking for 45-60 days conditional jail time. Froelich nothing to add. Def believes he has sat enough time.  Froelich: 8 days credit from when we were able to take custody. Agent Lynner addresses. Court: imposes 45 days conditional jail and credit for time since January 9th, 15 days. Release date will be February 23, 2017.
from Probation Agent P Lynner re: probation violations and asking for 45-60 conditional jail time with credit from 1/16/17.

10:37 Defendant David John Seifert in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: Agreement reached, ready for plea. Froelich:  Seifert plead to count 1,  S/W  2 years no specific conditions other than those put forth by agent.  Atty Bub agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty.  
Court Orders:  S/W 2 years, defendant may be discharged early if agent requests.  No specific conditions, only those set by the agent, court costs and DNA Surcharge totaling $515.00 to be paid over probation.    Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:51
Preliminary Hearing, Arraignment held on July 23, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR Carlson
Defendant's filed by Atty Bub
Motion hearing at 02-18-2016 10:30 am.
Plea hearing at 02-02-2016 10:15 am
Motion hearing at 11-23-2015 11:30 am.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 09-28-2015 08:45 am.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to count 1 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court  Pretrial Conference to be set  The bond will continue as ordered.  Conditions reviewed with defendant.

10:33 a.m.  Defendant David John Seifert in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich calls Deputy Mitch Rhiel.  Froelich examines Deputy Rhiel.  Rhiel identifies defendant.  Bub cross-examines Deputy Rhiel.  Bub gives argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Christopher Bub
Preliminary hearing at 07-23-2015 10:00 am
